alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:50AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms could impact portions of northwestern Dawson County by 945 AM CDT... At 844 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking severe thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stapleton to 8 miles north of North Platte Airport. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. These storms are still at least 30 to 45 minutes away from potentially reaching parts of western Dawson County, and it is a bit unclear as to what intensity they will have by the time they reach the area. However, if they do remain severe, a Severe Thunderstorm Warning may eventually be needed for parts of the area. Locations impacted include... Gothenburg. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 209 and 216. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
